headline: Gladys Bourdain, 85, Times Copy Editor Who Helped Her Son Rise From Unnoticed Chef to Global Star
abstract: A Times copy editor, she kick-started Anthony Bourdainâ€™s career when she helped him get a tell-all article about the restaurant world published in The New Yorker.
lead_paragraph: Gladys Bourdain, a longtime copy editor at The New York Times who helped kick-start the writing career of her son Anthony, the chef who became a world-famous memoirist and television host, died on Friday at a hospice facility in the Bronx. She was 85.
